reg_pit.title:
Part XX
Vehicular Traffic on Industrial Roads Regulations

change.changenote: Section 2 definitions of "crew car" or "crummy" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 76/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: crew car or crummy means a motor vehicle intended for the transportation of workmen, the seating capacity of which exceeds 9 passengers;

change.changenote: Section 17 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 76/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The driver of a truck referred to in subsection (1) must ensure that the tanks and water supply referred to in that subsection are under his or her control at all times.

change.changenote: Section 41 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 76/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The industrial road administrator may, upon its own roads and for a period not exceeding 30 days, engage any suitable employee as a student driver on any of its own motor vehicles; provided that such an employee is the holder of a valid driver's licence issued under the Motor Vehicle Act, that the industrial road administrator is in possession of medical proof as to the student's physical fitness to drive the type of vehicle upon which he is being trained, and that a certified driver accompanies him while driving until the industrial road administrator is satisfied the student is sufficiently proficient to take over control of the vehicle.

change.changenote: Section 52 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 76/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Except where a regular watchman is on duty and has signalled vehicles to proceed over any railway crossing, the drivers of crew cars transporting passengers on any road, public or otherwise, shall cause their vehicles to come to a full stop before crossing any railway, and shall not cross until sure the railway is clear of trains in both directions, and while in the process of crossing the tracks transmission gears shall not be shifted.
